title: GLBT ADVOCACY & YOUTH SERVICES, INC. (GLBTAYS)
intro: GLBT Advocacy & Youth Services, Inc. is dedicated to engaging in effective advocacy for LGBTQ people and to ensuring the well-being of youth and young adults struggling due to sexual orientation or gender identity issues.

title: IDENTITY, INC
intro: Identity, Inc. builds the infrastructure for a strong LGBTQ community in Alaska through its core programs, including Youth Program Support.

title: 1n10
intro: The mission of 1n10 is to serve LGBTQA youth and young adults. It works to enhance their lives by providing empowering social and service programs that promote self‐expression, self‐acceptance, leadership development and healthy life choices.

title: NWA CENTER FOR EQUALITY
intro: Youth Equality Services (YES) is an LGBTQ youth program providing a safe space for open dialogue, support and authentic self-expression.

title: THE PACIFIC CENTER
intro: The Pacific Center offers extensive LGBTQ youth programming, including free drop-in groups, counseling and opportunities for activism. The Pacific Center also offers HIV counseling and information about testing sites.

title: STONEWALL ALLIANCE CENTER
intro: The Stonewall Alliance Center has provided a drop-in group for LGBTQ youth since 1994. Currently, it has two discussion groups, SAY Twenties and SAY Teens.

title: L.A. GAY & LESBIAN CENTER
intro: The Youth Center is a safe, welcoming place where youth can get free meals, clothing and emergency shelter, as well as housing and education support.

title: LIFEWORKS MENTORING
intro: LifeWorks Mentoring offers two mentoring programs for LGBTQ youth ages 15-24. For youth ages 15 and older, LifeSupport is a weekly peer mentoring program where youth can come and talk with peers, make friends and take part in monthly workshops.

title: SISTERS OF SAKIA
intro: Sisters of Sakia is a collective that exists to empower and specifically address the needs of young queer women of African descent.

title: ZUNA INSTITUTE
intro: Zuna proposes that in order to counter the effect of the disproportionate impact of social discrimination and stigma on black lesbians, we need the development of a healthy black lesbian identity.

title: THE CENTER LONG BEACH
intro: Mentoring Youth Through Empowerment (MYTE) is committed to improving the quality of life for LGBTQ youth by providing a safe, affirmative environment for peer interaction and by enlisting informed, productive and positive role models.

title: STANISLAUS PRIDE CENTER
intro: The GLBTQ Youth Group provides social opportunities and support to LGBTQ and allied youth ages 14 to 9. Youth can expect a safe, friendly and confidential environment, with food and music provided.

title: SACRAMENTO GAY AND LESBIAN CENTER
intro: The Center provides a safe place for LGBT people to seek free legal assistance, referrals and information without judgment.

title: WALDEN FAMILY SERVICES
intro: Walden Family Services’ LGBTQ Network is designed to meet the special needs of LGBTQ foster youth.

title: LARKIN STREET YOUTH SERVICES
intro: With 25 comprehensive youth service programs located throughout San Francisco in over 13 sites, Larkin Street Youth Services is now an internationally recognized model successfully integrating street outreach and emergency shelter, primary medical care, transitional housing, and job training and scholarship assistance to get homeless and at risk kids off the streets.

title: THE LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL, TRANSGENDER COMMUNITY CENTER OF SAN DIEGO
intro: The Youth Housing Project will provide 23 units of affordable, supportive housing for youth between 18-24 years of age, with a special focus on LGBTQ youth who are currently transitioning out of foster care and/or group homes or living in the streets.

title: THE ARK OF REFUGE
intro: The Ark of Refuge runs a 15 person transitional living facility specifically targeting LGBTQ young adults in San Francisco.

title: CENTER FOR YOUNG WOMEN’S DEVELOPMENT
intro: CYWD provides on-going opportunities to young low- income lesbians of color who are involved in the juvenile justice system and who have lived and worked on the streets of San Francisco.

title: LEGAL SERVICES FOR CHILDREN
intro: LSC provides confidential legal and related social services to LGBTQ young people, free of charge. LSC also provides legal representation in cases of guardianship, emancipation, child abuse and neglect and school discipline.

title: ASIAN AND PACIFIC ISLANDER WELLNESS CENTER
intro: AQU25A (Asian & Pacific Islander Queer and Questioning Under 25, Altogether) is a program of Asian/Pacific Islander (including multiracial/multiethnic APA) LGBTQ youth age 25 and under.

title: THE CENTER ORANGE COUNTY
intro: This LGBT community center offers free drop-in HIV testing six days a week, with a special youth drop-in from 1:30-6 PM Wednesdays, as well as recreational youth programming.

title: BILLY DEFRANK LGBT COMMUNITY CENTER
intro: LGBTQ Youth Space is a community drop-in center and mental health program for LGBTQ and allied youth ages 13-25 who live in Santa Clara County.

title: SPECTRUM
intro: Spectrum is currently hosting a monthly support group for LGBTQ youth ages 14-19.

title: SOUTH BAY CENTER
intro: The Outlet is a social network for LGBTQ young adults ages 18-30.

title: REACH LA
intro: Through its media arts programs, REACH LA is committed to advocacy of LGBTQ youth rights, visibility for the LGBTQ youth of color community, fostering LGBTQ youth creative media expressions and building connections to existing resources.

title: BIENESTAR
intro: Mpowerment is Bienestar’s community level intervention program targeting gay/bisexual Latino youth ages 18 to 24 at risk of HIV infection.

title: THE CENTER
intro: The Hillcrest Youth Center is a drop-in and recreational center in San Diego County serving primarily Latino, African-American, Asian and Pacific Islanders, and Native American LGBTQ youth.

title: THE GLBT COMMUNITY CENTER OF COLORADO
intro: Rainbow Alley is a drop-in center for youth, including many in Out-of-Home care, that provides education, advocacy, support and fun.

title: LA GENTE UNIDA
intro: La Gente Unida is an organization serving the needs of LGBTQ Latinas and Latinos in the Denver and Colorado Area.

title: THE TWO SPIRIT NATIONAL CULTURAL EXCHANGE
intro: The Two Spirit Society of Denver provides community outreach to GBLT Two Spirit, Native, youth, elders, and the non-Native community.

title: HARTFORD GAY AND LESBIAN HEALTH COLLECTIVE
intro: Hartford Gay and Lesbian Health Collective offers HIV counseling, education and outreach programs and several support groups, including the Rainbow Room for LGBTQ youth ages 13-21.

title: TRUE COLORS, SEXUAL MINORITY YOUTH AND FAMILY SERVICES
intro: Components of the Safe Harbor Project include foster parent recruitment, an LGBTQ youth mentoring program and comprehensive training for those who work with LGBTQ youth.

title: OUTSPOKEN
intro: Outspoken is a confidential social and support group for LGBTQ youth ages 16-22.
address: Triangle Community Center River View Plaza, 19 River Street

title: J.U.S.T. FOR YOUTH
intro: J.U.S.T. for Youth aims to create a safe and nurturing environment for sexual and gender minority youth in families, schools and communities, while reducing risk behaviors so they can develop into healthy adults.

title: COMPASS (GAY AND LESBIAN COMMUNITY CENTER OF THE PALM BEACHES)
intro: The HOPE Program offers a safe, non-judgmental environment staffed by experienced counselors and trained professionals and offers weekly social and support groups.

title: ALSO OUT YOUTH
intro: ALSO offers social activities, workshops, one-on-one individual attention and crisis support for GLBT youth.

title: JACKSONVILLE AREA SEXUAL MINORITY YOUTH NETWORK, INC. (JASMYN)
intro: JASMYN provides support and advocacy for LGBTQ youth under the age of 24 who are currently or were formerly in foster care.

title: ORLANDO YOUTH ALLIANCE
intro: The mission of OYA! Is to provide a non-exploitative, safe, drug and alcohol-free social outlet for youth ages 13-20 who are dealing with LGBTQ issues.

title: THE ALLIANCE FOR GLBTQ YOUTH
intro: The Alliance for GLBTQ Youth offers care coordination, community-based group and individual counseling, prevention education and youth enrichment activities.

title: PRIDELINES YOUTH SERVICES
intro: Pridelines is dedicated to supporting, educating and empowering South Florida’s LGBTQ youth in a safe and diverse environment.

title: THE PRIDE CENTER
intro: The LGBTQS Youth Group includes two groups, one for teens ages 13-17 and young adults ages 18-21 that provide a youth-led safe space.

title: SUNSHINE SOCIAL SERVICES, INC.
intro: Sunshine Social Services provides life assistance and mental health care for the LGBTQ community with a focus on economically disadvantaged and marginalized youth.

title: ZEBRA COALITION
intro: The Zebra Coalition is a network of organizations that provides services to LGBTQ youth. These organizations assess and support youth in need of shelter, emotional or spiritual guidance, medical services or education.

title: ATLANTA JEWISH LGBT CENTER
intro: The Center offers a compassionate Jewish response to LGBT Jewish people and their families by delivering support, education and resources.

title: THE RAINBOW PROGRAM
intro: The CHRIS Rainbow Program provides a safe and supportive residence for homeless LGBTQ youth.

title: YOUTHPRIDE
intro: Youth Pride offers Safe Zone, a daily after-school program, and regular support and discussion groups.

title: FIERCE YOUTH RECLAIMING AND EMPOWERING (FYRE)
intro: Fierce Youth Reclaiming & Empowering (FYRE) seeks to support and build the leadership and power of LGBTQ youth of color and their allies, in Atlanta and statewide.

title: BOISE GLBT COMMUNITY CENTER
intro: Youth Alliance for Diversity strives to provide youth with the opportunity to meet and receive the support of other youth who are LGBTQ and allied.

title: AFFINITY COMMUNITY SERVICES
intro: Affinity Community Services is a social justice organization that works with and on behalf of Black LGBTQ communities, queer youth and allies.

title: UP CENTER OF CHAMPAIGN COUNTY
intro: Talk it UP is a peer-run LGBTQ support group for middle and high-school youth. LGBTQ youth can expect an atmosphere of acceptance and support while meeting other LGBTQ youth.

title: MID ILLINOIS YOUTH ALLIANCE
intro: The Mid Illinois Youth Alliance is a group of LGBTQ youth and their allies who meet weekly.

title: HOWARD BROWN HEALTH CENTER- BROADWAY YOUTH CENTER
intro: Howard Brown’s Broadway Youth Center (BYC) is a safe space in which young people can access compassionate support, life-saving healthcare, and a range of support services.

title: HORIZONS COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC.
intro: Horizons Youth Group provides a safe, supportive environment for LGBTQ youth and young adults to meet and socialize.

title: PROJECT VIDA
intro: The CRU (Committed, Responsible, United) is Project Vida’s program for LGBTQ, curious, and down-low Latino & African American men 14-24 years old.

title: INDIANA YOUTH GROUP
intro: IYG provides a safe place, a confidential environment and services which foster self-esteem, resiliency and positive decision-making skills among LGBTQ young people.

title: OZONE HOUSE
intro: Ozone House provides a crisis line, emergency youth shelter, transitional housing, drop-in center, counseling, case management, street outreach, community education and QueerZone, a social and support group for LGBTQ youth.

title: UNITED ACTION FOR YOUTH
intro: The GLBTQ & A Youth Group is a free, informal, drop- in social and support group for LGBTQ and allied junior and senior high aged youth.

title: IOWA PRIDE NETWORK
intro: The Iowa Pride Network is a state-wide non-profit organization that works directly with students, helping empower them to start and enhance gay-straight alliances in their high schools and colleges.

title: LOUISVILLE YOUTH GROUP
intro: LYG provides a safe, fun space for LGBTQ youth.

title: JUVENILE JUSTICE PROJECT OF LOUISIANA
intro: The LGBT and HIV/AIDS Project is dedicated to ensuring that LGBT youth in the juvenile justice system receive quality representation and secure care facilities and significantly reducing the number of incidents of violence and harassment experienced by this population in secure confinement.

title: LGBT COMMUNITY CENTER OF NEW ORLEANS
intro: The young adult peer support and social group is open to all people ages 18-24.

title: BROTHERHOOD INC.
intro: MyHOUSE is a program of Brotherhood, Inc. that targets youth at high risk for HIV, including men of color who have sex with men and young transgender persons of color.

title: PRYSM
intro: PRYSM provides a safe and positive space for LGBTQ and allied youth, offering social support, leadership development, psycho-education about common problems facing youth and community education.

title: UNITARIAN UNIVERSALIST CHURCH OF ROCKVILLE
intro: The Rainbow Youth Alliance is a support group for LGBTQ and allied teens. RYA is a safe place to ask questions, find mutual support and learn information pertinent to their lives.

title: GLBT COMMUNITY CENTER OF BALTIMORE AND CENTRAL MARYLAND
intro: Sufficient As I aM (SAIM) is a support group for youth dealing with issues of sexuality, coming out, relationships, etc.

title: BAGLY-BOSTON ALLIANCE OF GLBT YOUTH
intro: The Boston Alliance of GLBT Youth is a youth-led, adult-supported social support organization committed to social justice and creating, sustaining and advocating for programs, policies and services for GLBT youth aged 22 and under.

title: BOSTON GLASS COMMUNITY CENTER
intro: GLASS provides a drop-in center for LGBTQ youth aged 13-25. It is a safe space to relax and socialize with trained adults who are available to talk.

title: JUSTICE RESOURCE INITIATIVE-HEALTH
intro: JRI-Health offers programs addressing the needs of persons at risk of or living with HIV/AIDS, for homeless, troubled, and GLBT youth, and for persons with a broad range of disabilities requiring supported housing.

title: WALTHAM HOUSE
intro: Waltham House is a residential home that can house up to twelve LGBTQ youth ages 14-18.

title: ANN ARBOR’S TEEN CENTER
intro: Riot Youth is a space for youth to talk and find support about their struggles as LGBTQ youth.

title: RUTH ELLIS CENTER
intro: The Center provides residential and drop-in programs for LGBTQ youth. Ruth’s House provides youth 12-21 with two programs: semi-independent living for youth ages 12-17 and transitional living for those aged 16-21. Second Stories is a Monday-Friday drop-in center.

title: TRANS YOUTH FAMILY ALLIES
intro: TYFA empowers children and families by partnering with educators, service providers and communities to develop supportive environments in which gender may be expressed and respected.

title: OZONE HOUSE
intro: QueerZone is a weekly program that provides a safe space for LGBTQ youth to congregate, socialize, build community and access support.

title: YOUTHLINK
intro: One housing program offered by Youth Link is the Host Home Program in which carefully-screened GLBT members open their homes to GLBT youth.

title: DISTRICT 202
intro: District 202 is a youth community center committed to providing social, cultural and educational opportunities by and for LGBT youth and their friends.

title: JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER OF THE GREATER ST. PAUL AREA
intro: The St. Paul JCC teen department supports teens who identify as GLBT or who are questioning their sexuality.

title: SHADES OF YELLOW
intro: INSPIRE is Shades of Yellow’s youth-led program aimed towards developing youth leadership for LGBTQ Hmong (an Asian ethnic group from the mountainous regions of China, Vietnam, Laos, and Thailand) youth aged 14-24.

title: GROWING AMERICAN YOUTH
intro: Growing American Youth is a social and support organization for LGBTQ youth 21 and under.

title: PASSAGES
intro: Passages is a youth group for LGBTQ and allied youth, providing educational information and experiences to encourage personal growth and social interaction to ease their transition into self-acceptance and to become empowered.

title: THE EQUAL YOUTH CENTER
intro: EQUAL was founded on the belief that by giving youth the power to organize, lead and collaborate, youth would not only transform themselves, but transform their communities.

title: WESTERN MONTANA COMMUNITY CENTER
intro: Youth Forward is a safe and confidential gathering of LGBTQ youth ages 13-19.

title: RAINBOW OUTREACH METRO OMAHA GLBT CENTER, GLBT CENTER YOUTH PROGRAM
intro: The Center Youth program is a safe and supportive place for LGBTQ and allied youth ages 13-23 to make friends.

title: PROUD HORIZONS YOUTH GROUP
intro: Proud Horizons is a youth group specifically for LGBTQ and allied youth ages 13 to 23.

title: GAY AND LESBIAN COMMUNITY CENTER OF SOUTHERN NEVADA
intro: R.U.1.2. Youth Group consists of 13-19 year old LGBT and allied youth. The participants are educated on HIV prevention, coming out issues, drug and alcohol abuse and many other topics.

title: CROSSROADS PROGRAMS, INC.
intro: Project DISCOVERY provides specialized foster homes for LGBTQ youth, aged 12-21, who are not able to live at home but who are capable of functioning in a home environment with extra support.

title: PRIDE CENTER OF NEW JERSEY
intro: The Youth Drop-in is for LGBTIQ and allied youth ages 17 and under.

title: SOCIAL JUSTICE CENTER
intro: The Social Justice Center offers True Colors, a drop-in program for LGBTQ youth and young adults.

title: AFRICAN AMERICAN OFFICE OF GAY CONCERNS
intro: T.G.I.F. (Thank Goodness I’m Fabulous) provides support to young African-American and Latina transgender girls.

title: OUTRIGHT
intro: Outright is a social & support group for LGBTQ youth.

title: OUTRIGHT
intro: Outright is a social & support group for LGBTQ youth.

title: OUTRIGHT
intro: Outright is a social & support group for LGBTQ youth.

title: U21
intro: U21 is open to LGBTQ and allied youth under 21. It is largely a social time with some planned events and sessions, such as arts & crafts, poetry, information on the community, films, dances and workshops.

title: TRANS YOUTH SUPPORT GROUP
address: Young Women United, 120 Morningside Drive NE

title: AIDS COMMUNITY RESOURCES
intro: AIDS Community Resources is a center of support for LGBTQ youth throughout New York State. The Q Center offers a number of programs, support group meetings, and activities for youth.

title: ASIAN AND PACIFIC ISLANDER COALITION ON HIV/AIDS (APICHA)
intro: APICHA offers a Young People’s Project, as well as a weekly LGBTQ Asian and Pacific Islander youth group.

title: THE AUDRE LORDE PROJECT
intro: The Audre Lorde Project is a Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Two Spirit, Trans and Gender Non-Conforming People of Color community organizing center, focusing on the New York City area.

title: THE AUDRE LORDE PROJECT
intro: The Audre Lorde Project is a Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Two Spirit, Trans and Gender Non-Conforming People of Color community organizing center, focusing on the New York City area.

title: BRONX COMMUNITY PRIDE CENTER
intro: Youth Services includes The Spot Next Door, a drop-in center open Monday-Friday; Operation Home Base, a case management program for homeless and at-risk youth; free legal services; the Youth Leadership Institute and a Youth Advisory Board.

title: THE ALI FORNEY CENTER (AFC) HEADQUARTERS
intro: The Ali Forney Center offers a Day Center, Emergency Housing Program and Transitional Housing for LGBTQ youth.

title: HEALTH AND EDUCATION ALTERNATIVES FOR TEENS
intro: HEAT’s LGBT program provides case management, HIV/STD screening, mental health services, hormone therapy treatment and various social and support groups.

title: SCO FAMILY SERVICES
intro: SCO Family Services provides a continuum of community based residential programs for 24 homeless and at-risk LGBTQ youth.

title: METROPOLITAN COMMUNITY CHURCH OF NEW YORK
intro: Sylvia’s Place is an emergency night shelter with beds for GLBTQ youth ages 16-23. It accepts walk-ins after 6PM 365 days a year.

title: NEW ALTERNATIVES
intro: New Alternatives provides basic items, case management, recreation, community building, several support groups and a Life Skills dinner group for homeless LGBT youth ages 16-24.

title: GAY ALLIANCE OF THE GENESEE VALLEY
intro: The Youth Center is dedicated to providing a safe and supportive place for youth ages 13-23 to discuss issues, make friends and get support.

title: THE JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER
intro: The JCC offers two social and support groups for LGBTQ Jewish youth: Cometfire for youth aged 11-14, and Jqyouth for young adults aged 18-30.

title: CAPITAL PRIDE CENTER
intro: Center Youth offers LGBTQ and allied youth ages 13-18 a peer support group, healthy social opportunities and various opportunities to participate in activism.

title: GREEN CHIMNEYS CHILDREN’S SERVICES, INC.
intro: The Gramercy Residence houses 25 LGBTQ teenagers in foster care aged 16-21. It provides a Supervised Independent Living Program, the agency operated boarding home for LGBTQ youth 12-16; a Transitional Living Apartment Program for youth 17-21 and a Basic Center that provides emergency shelter and referrals for homeless and runaway youth 14-21.

title: HETRICK-MARTIN INSTITUTE
intro: The Supportive Services Department of the Hetrick- Martin Institute provides services for homeless and at- risk LGBTQ youth.

title: URBAN JUSTICE CENTER
intro: The Peter Cicchino Youth Project provides legal services to LGBT youth who are homeless, in foster care or in the juvenile justice system.

title: LAWYERS FOR CHILDREN
intro: LFC has published a handbook for GLBTQ youth in foster care with a list of resources in NYC and information about legal rights. They also provide legal services to GLBTQ youth in foster care.

title: STATEN ISLAND LGBT CENTER
intro: The Center offers extensive youth programming, including a drop-in space, support groups for teens and young adults, safer sex resources and opportunities to develop creative and leadership skills.

title: THE DOOR
intro: In addition to health, legal, education, counseling and career services, the Door also provides a wide range of programs and services geared towards LGBTQ members.

title: FIERCE
intro: FIERCE is a membership-based organization building the leadership and power of LGBTQ youth of color in New York City. It develops politically conscious leaders who are invested in improving themselves and their communities through youth-led campaigns, leadership development programs, and cultural expression.

title: GAY MEN OF AFRICAN DESCENT (GMAD)
intro: MARS is the young adult program of GMAD, an organization of gay, bisexual, transgender and questioning men of color. MARS offers members training workshops, recreational activities, connections to local shelters and service organizations and a positive space for GBTQ youth to socialize.

title: THE RASHAWN BRAZELL MEMORIAL SCHOLARSHIP MENTORING PROGRAM
intro: The Rashawn Brazell Memorial Scholarship Mentoring Program connects scholars to a variety of professionals who have pledged time and support for the Memorial Fund, as well as the larger community of African- descended LGBT people and their allies.

title: SYLVIA RIVERA LAW PROJECT
intro: Sylvia Rivera Law Project provides free legal services to transgender, intersex and gender nonconforming low- income people and people of color. It represents and advises clients in a variety of contexts.

title: NORTH CAROLINA LAMBDA YOUTH NETWORK
intro: NCLYN is collaborating with a transitional housing agency in Durham to offer a residential program specifically for LGBTQ youth.

title: LGBT CENTER OF RALEIGH
intro: The Center includes youth programming.

title: WRENN HOUSE
intro: Wrenn House is the only homeless/runaway crisis intervention program and shelter for youth in the Triangle. It partners with the LGBT Center of Raleigh to provide services for LGBTQ youth.

title: TIME OUT YOUTH
intro: Time Out Youth is dedicated to providing support, advocacy and education to LGBTQ and allied youth aged 13-23 in Charlotte and the surrounding areas.

title: LGBT COMMUNITY CENTER OF GREATER CLEVELAND
intro: The Center offers counseling support for youth ages 14-24. Youth programming and HIV testing is open to LGBTQ youth ages 14-24. The Trans-Formers program is a support group for trans young adults ages 18-30, facilitated by a licensed counselor.

title: RAINBOW AREA YOUTH (RAY)
intro: Rainbow Area Youth (RAY) is a peer-based support group created to provide emotional support, social opportunities, and health education to sexual minority teens.
address: St. Mark’s Episcopal Church 2272 Collingwood Boulevard

title: KALEIDOSCOPE YOUTH CENTER
intro: Kaleidoscope Youth Center provides a drop-in center, counseling, homework help, and various recreational & educational opportunities.

title: CENTRAL OKLAHOMA TRANSGENDER SUPPORT GROUP
intro: This group is for transgender people and their allies.

title: OKC YOUTH UNITED
intro: The mission of Oklahoma City Youth United is to provide a safe, inclusive and affirming environment to youth, 14-20, of all genders and sexual orientations from the Oklahoma City metropolitan area.

title: OPENARMS YOUTH PROJECT
intro: Openarms brings LGBTQ and allied youth together to build a peer-based community that empowers them to end isolation, create a progressive youth voice and increase well being and self-esteem.

title: YOUTH SERVICES OF TULSA –LGBTQ SUPPORT GROUP
SEXUAL MINORITY YOUTH RESOURCE CENTER (SMYRC)
intro: SMYRC provides a safe, supervised, harassment-free and alcohol- and drug-free space for sexual minority youth ages 23 and younger.

title: OUTSIDE IN
intro: Outside In provides housing, education, employment, counseling, medical care, food, recreation and a safe space. Outside In is a national leader in serving LGBTQ youth.

title: TRANSACTIVE
intro: TransActive is a monthly social & support group for trans youth 12-21.
address: OHSU Richmond Clinic 3930 S.E. Division Street

title: LUTHERAN CHILD AND FAMILY SERVICES OF SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA
intro: Bethel House is a group home for dependent LGBT youth aged 15-18, in Philadelphia, PA.

title: ATTIC YOUTH CENTER
intro: The Attic creates opportunities for LGBTQ youth to develop into healthy, independent, civic-minded adults within a safe and supportive community, and promotes the acceptance of LGBTQ youth in society.

title: YOUTH PRIDE, INC.
intro: YPI’s programming is dedicated to meeting the social, emotional and educational needs of LGBTQ youth.

title: AFFIRM
intro: AFFIRM provides LGBTQ youth education, social activities and referrals to related services.

title: WE ARE FAMILY
intro: SafeSpace is a weekly gathering of LGBTQ and allied youth 16-23 who get together to share their experiences, express their feelings, and find encouragement among their peers.

title: THE BLACK HILLS CENTER FOR EQUALITY
intro: PRISM is a gay-straight alliance for youth ages 15-25 that provides support to young people who are in the process of coming out, as well as their allies.

title: CENTER FOR EQUALITY
intro: The Drop-in Center is open regularly for youth and the general community.

title: ONE-IN-TEEN YOUTH SERVICES
intro: The Mission of One-In-Teen Youth Services, Inc. shall be to provide a continuum of support and services to benefit LGBTQ youth and youth-serving agencies throughout Middle Tennessee.

title: MEMPHIS GAY AND LESBIAN COMMUNITY CENTER
intro: Queer as Youth is a place for youth ages 14 to 19 to meet and hang out with other youth while learning and expressing their creativity in a safe space.

title: OUT YOUTH
intro: Out Youth’s mission is to promote the well-being of sexual minority youth so that they can openly and safely explore and affirm their identities.

title: YOUTH FIRST TEXAS
intro: Youth First Texas provides numerous resources for LGBTQ and allied youth, including counseling services, support groups, educational programming, recreational activities and leadership development.

title: VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA - UTAH’S HOMELESS YOUTH RESOURCE CENTER
intro: HYRC runs a 3-part program for homeless youth, and about 30% of the youth it serves report being LGBTQ. Programs include a drop-in center, a transitional living center and a street outreach program that focuses on reaching young male prostitutes.

title: GLBT COMMUNITY CENTER OF UTAH
intro: The Youth Activity Center’s mission is to bring sexual minority youth together to build a peer-based community. The YAC serves homeless LGBTQ youth and LGBTQ youth in foster care.

title: UTAH PRIDE CENTER
intro: Tolerant Intelligent Network of Teens (TINT) is the Center’s youth activity center which provides a safe place for LGBTQ people ages 14-20.

title: OUTRIGHT VERMONT
intro: The Mission of Outright is to build safe, healthy, and supportive environments for LGBTQ youth.

title: YOUTH OF COLOR SUPPORT GROUP –CASEY FAMILY SERVICES
intro: This group is open to all teens of color, ages 13 to 17, in Vermont’s Upper Valley. It meets on the first Sunday of the month.

title: ROSMY
intro: Richmond Organization for Sexual Minority Youth (ROSMY) was created for all youth aged 14-20 who are LGBTQ. ROSMY offers a drop-in center, support groups, a youth support line and a leadership program.

title: LA-BA-TE-YAH YOUTH HOME COMMUNITY
intro: La-Ba-Te-Yah is an independent living program for homeless youth, for urban Native Americans and youth of color. There is case management on site. It includes a Two-Spirit Program.

title: SEATTLE COUNSELING SERVICES
intro: Seattle Counseling Services specializes in providing mental health services to the LGBTQI community. Youth Services offers counseling and support groups for youth.

title: LAMBERT HOUSE
intro: Lambert House is a center for LGBTQ and allied youth ages 14-23 that encourages empowerment through the development of leadership, social and life skills.

title: OASIS YOUTH CENTER
intro: Oasis is the only drop-in and support center dedicated to the needs of GLBTQ youth ages 14-24 in Pierce County and is a program of the Pierce County AIDS Foundation.

title: VISTA YOUTH CENTER
intro: Vista Youth Center offers LGBTQ individuals between the ages of 14-21 a unique combination of direct service, social service and referrals.

title: ADVOCATES FOR YOUTH
intro: Advocates for Youth champions efforts to help young people make informed and responsible decisions about their reproductive and sexual health. Advocates for Youth offers resources specifically for LGBTQ youth and their families.

title: SEXUAL MINORITY YOUTH ASSISTANCE LEAGUE (SMYAL)
intro: SMYAL is a center for LGBTQI youth that has a comprehensive list of housing options for youth and can refer to youth to the LGBT friendly housing.

title: MY SISTAHS
intro: MySistahs was created by and for young women of color to provide information and offer support on sexual and reproductive health issues through education and advocacy.

title: MILWAUKEE LGBT COMMUNITY CENTER
intro: Project Q, the youth program of the Milwaukee LGBT Community Center, provides a safe space for LGBTQ and allied youth ages 24 and under.

title: LGBT CENTER OF SOUTHEAST WISCONSIN
intro: The center offers programs and services for LGBTQ people, youth, transgender people, people of color and those with HIV/AIDS, LGBT seniors, parents and family of LGBT youth and children with LGBT parents.
